subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... I meant HE, yes. And HE does not match VOW. VOW is a deep letter. HE is a high letter. ... SHE is a tall letter and is unified with SURE. THEY is a deep
messageBody:
On 14 Apr 2013, at 20:42, Zyggy2 <jayson@...> wrote:

> I presume you mean shavian quikscript letter HE for a disunification? But that can't be right since QS HE matches Shavian VOW.

I meant HE, yes. And HE does not match VOW. VOW is a deep letter. HE is a high letter.

> SHE will certainly need to be added since it is a deep version of THEY and both cannot be the same code in the same script. Whereas QS THEY *can* match with Shavian SURE.

SHE is a tall letter and is unified with SURE. THEY is a deep letter.

> ADDITIONS:
> 1 BAY

Glyph variant of BIB. Handwriting or font will just draw it with a left loop. It is still a deep letter matched to tall letter PEEP.

> 2 TEA

Glyph variant of TOT. Handwriting or font will just draw it without the tick. It is still a deep letter matched to tall letter PEEP.

> 3 DAY

This isn't even a glyph variant. It is identical to DEAD.

> 4 GAY

Glyph variant of GAG. The loop is just a pen flourish.

> 5 THEY

The essential movement is the downward curve. The loop can be considered flourish.

> 6 VIE

The essential movement is the downward curve. The loop can be considered flourish.

And so on.

Basically given height or depth pairs and an essential ductus I am happy to unify most of the Quikscript letters with the Shavian. Except for:

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER HE which is tall and not deep and has no relation to HA-HA.

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER MAY which is deep and has no relation to MIME

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER NO which is short and not at all similar to NUN, nor paired with MIME.

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER LOW which is not paired with ROAR, but rather with the new LLAN.

And of course these are just new:

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER WHY (new)

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER LLAN (new)

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER LOCH (new)

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER EXCITE (new)

SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER EXAMINE (new)

A Shavian font should have nine letters added to it. A Quickscript font will need glyphs for six: HA-HA, LOLL, MIME, NUN, UP, and ERR (even though they aren't used). They are not hard to design.

I am uploading a unification doc to the files section of this forum.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
